channel.title: Laptop Care
channel.description:
So i don't use my laptop much, but last night i was lying on my bed watching a couple of hours of episodes, at the end i felt underneath the laptop and it was that hot, that i could not even hold my hands on it for 1 second. hot air was blowing out fast from the side, i felt like anytime the battery would explode or something, that shit was HOT. (the laptop was lying on a blanket, which sinked in a bit and i think the blanket might have sorta not let much air get out the side)
i'm sure this isn't good, i go download some temperature software now, do laptop cooling pads really work? i found it strange that just playing movies it caused it to get so damn hot, on my main pc when watching movies my temps/usage don't even jump one bit.

item.title: Laptop Care
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Or set the laptop on your lap so the fan is off of your leg.

Read full topic

item.title: Laptop Care
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

My laptop idles at 70C. Just need to watch out that I don’t burn my hands.

Read full topic

item.title: Laptop Care
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

i just put a book or a folder under mine when its on the bed…

Read full topic

item.title: Laptop Care
item.dc:creator: @the1337legend the1337legend
item.description:
@the1337legend wrote:

basically what unhandled said, any soft surface such as a blanket, bed, pillow doesnt let enough air out, although tbh your lucky, my laptop crashes about 20 seconds after touching my bed :l

if you can, put it on the edge of the bed to let the fan blow out, or buy a cooling pad

Read full topic

item.title: Laptop Care
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Yeah I’ve had this problem. You really can’t put laptops on blankets or soft surfaces, ever. Put it on a table next to your bed, and get one of those cooling pads, they do work.

Read full topic
